newsitem.title: USA: Worldwide says prepared to buy out Total.
newsitem.headline: Worldwide says prepared to buy out Total.

text.p: Worldwide Leisure Corp said it is prepared to acquire 80 percent of the stock of Total World TeleCommunications Inc for $33 million.

Worldwide said it would buy 80 percent of Total's stock for $11 million in cash and at least 11 million shares of Worldwide, or at least 22 million shares of Worldwide stock. Both offers are valued at least $33 million, said the company.

"We have spoken to management of Total World, and they are prepared to cooperate with WWLC in such an offer, following appropriate review, and look forward to an early meeting," said Worldwide chief executive George Pappas.

The acquisition is the second announced by Worldwide in the last 35 days, it said. Last month, the company said it would acquire American Western Cos, a non-traditional healthcare insurer. Also pending is an acquisition of Thessaliki Spirit Co, a Greek maker of wine and spirits.

On the Total deal, Pappas said, "This proposed acquisition would be the biggest step we have taken to date in our aggressive plan to build a diversified multi-national company with interests in a variety of high-growth industries."

Worldwide, based in Minneapolis, said it is "building a portfolio of interests in domestic and international companies with the intention of becoming active in the resort and casino and related industries."
